abstract: In a blow to private equity firm Lone Star, HSBC dropped a $6.3 billion offer for 51 percent of Korea Exchange Bank, blaming turmoil in financial markets and ending what would have been the biggest cross-border move in South Korea’s bank sector.
lead_paragraph: In a blow to private equity firm Lone Star, HSBC dropped a $6.3 billion offer for 51 percent of Korea Exchange Bank, blaming turmoil in financial markets and ending what would have been the biggest cross-border move in South Korea’s bank sector.

headline.main: HSBC Drops Bid for Lone Star’s K.E.B. Stake
